flawed_nl_solution:
Book 1 was $12.50 and book 2 was $15.00 so 13 +15 = $24
He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were 25% off so 24 * 0.25 = $6
These two books came out to 24-6 = $<<24-6=18>>18
Books 3 & 4 were both $10 each so 2*10 = $20
When you add all 4 books together, 18+20 = $<<18+20=38>>38
To get free shipping he would need to spend 50-38 = $<<50-38=12>>12 more on books
#### 12

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 28, not 24. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
